sentences.english: Under such a disadvantage, Chang An was hit by a security high voltage electric shock device.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣的劣勢下，常安被保安的高壓電擊器擊中。

sentences.english: Some say it can go against you but John has a strong mental approach to football.
sentences.chinese: 有人說這會是一個劣勢，但奧謝對足球決心很堅決。

sentences.english: It Be been to bad position forever, want all nest launch.
sentences.chinese: 永遠屈居於劣勢，想想都窩火呀。

sentences.english: We tend to make this line very fuzzy, turning a strength into a weakness.
sentences.chinese: 我們往往把界線劃得很模糊，把優勢變成了劣勢。

sentences.english: It is hard to say whether the use of organic LCD panels should be considered a disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 這是很難說是否有機液晶面板的使用應被視爲劣勢。

sentences.english: You have the choice to use the phenomenon to your advantage or disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 根據你的優勢或劣勢，你能選擇使用這一現象。

sentences.english: What are your strengths and weakness?
This is the advantage or disadvantage of a socialist/capitalistic type of system.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲，這是社會主義的優勢和資本主義的劣勢。

sentences.english: Yeah, it's very wonderful. The underdog side won the debater at last.
sentences.chinese: 很精彩，處於劣勢的一方最後還是贏了。

sentences.english: Cutaneous needle was used on the recessive side of spasm limbs of hemiplegia.
sentences.chinese: 梅花針輕釦偏癱肢體痙攣劣勢側。

sentences.english: Rebounding was his way of atoning for his inaccuracy.
sentences.chinese: 但籃板彌補了他在命中率方面的劣勢。

sentences.english: Both have advantages and disadvantages that will be discussed at length in this document.
sentences.chinese: 二者都有優勢和劣勢，這些將在本文最後進行討論。

sentences.english: You need to understand the connections and trade-offs between them.
sentences.chinese: 你需要去了解它們之間的聯繫和優劣勢。

sentences.english: Marcus made a great shot and saved the day for his team.
sentences.chinese: 馬克思投進了精彩的一球，替他那一隊扭轉了劣勢。

sentences.english: The development of Huangshi textile clothing industry has its inherent inferior position.
sentences.chinese: 黃石市紡織服裝業的發展有先天不足之劣勢。

sentences.english: If I go windsurfing, I'll look like a klutz.
sentences.chinese: 如果我去風帆，我就會像一個劣勢。

definition: to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
on the up/currently winning/rising (in popularity etc)
odds of success/stratagem that ensures success/to be sure of success
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
